description: From Middle English forethynken, from Old English fōreþenċan (“to premeditate, consider, be mindful”), corresponding to fore- +‎ think. Cognate with Dutch voordenken, German vordenken (“to think ahead”).

verbs.description: forethink (third-person singular simple present forethinks, present participle forethinking, simple past and past participle forethought)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To plan (something) in advance; think, consider, or contrive beforehand; prognosticate.
(transitive, rare) To think about beforehand; to anticipate.
